problem_text: Is every group generated by a set of 3-transpositions locally finite? A set of 3-transpositions is, by definition, a normal set of involutions such that the orders of their pairwise products are at most 3. A. I. Sozutov
answer: Yes, it is (H. Cuypers, J. I. Hall, in: Groups, combinatorics and geometry. Proc. L. M. S. Durham symp., July 5–15, 1990 (London Math. Soc. Lecture Note Ser., 165), Cambridge Univ. Press, 1992, 121–138).
